sentences.english: The oval frames work best on gals with strong jaw or a square face.
sentences.chinese: 椭圆形镜架最适合下巴线条硬朗或是方脸的女孩儿。

sentences.english: Though nearly seventy years of age, he is still hale and fresh as paint.
sentences.chinese: 他虽年近七十，但身子硬朗，精力充沛。

sentences.english: When my bone son hale grow wings, I began to learn to rush you retorted.
sentences.chinese: 当我的骨子硬朗长出羽翼，我开始学会冲您反唇相讥。

sentences.english: Life on a boat had hardened him.
sentences.chinese: 船上的生活已经使他变硬朗了。

sentences.english: It was so sharp and jagged and full of hard lines.
sentences.chinese: 它既锋利又不顺溜，遍身都是硬朗的线条。
其他费用增长就比较硬朗一些。

sentences.english: A medium-bodied and firm style of Clos Vougeot.
sentences.chinese: 这是一款酒体适中，馥若葡萄园硬朗风格的美酒。

sentences.english: New and classic camo prints look rugged on urban streets.
sentences.chinese: 新款和经典的迷彩印花在都市街道上显得粗犷硬朗。

sentences.english: Today season trousers is haler and forthright, clipping of cultivate one's morality but be not clingy body.
sentences.chinese: 今季裤子较硬朗豪爽，修身剪裁但并非紧贴身躯。

sentences.english: That old man is nearly ninety but fit as a fiddle.
sentences.chinese: 那老者年近九旬，但身体十分硬朗。

sentences.english: I played harder and stronger when you did that.
sentences.chinese: 当你那么做之后，我会打得更硬朗。

sentences.english: The hale and hearty man is counted among the old .
sentences.chinese: 那个硬朗矍铄的人就给归入老人的行列了。

definition: line (in drawing, calligraphy etc)/the lines or contours of a three-dimensional object (hairstyle, clothing, car etc)
(of a shape) sharp and clearcut/(of a person) definite in his opinion
